intro: Gymnadenia minor, commonly known as the lesser grass-of-Parnassus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, tuberous roots. Gymnadenia minor is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a rare or endangered species in many regions.
